request_0.formal_statement:
lemma prime_even:
  shows "prime p ⟷ (p = 2 ∨ (p > 2 ∧ odd p))"

request_1.formal_statement:
lemma factorization:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = (n - 2) * (n - 1)"

request_2.formal_statement:
lemma parity_analysis:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(n - 1) mod 2 ≠ (n - 2) mod 2"

request_3.formal_statement:
lemma prime_factorization:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "n^2 - 3n + 2 = (n - 2)(n - 1)"

request_4.formal_statement:
lemma product_prime:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" and "b > 0" and "a * b = p" and "prime p"
  shows "a = 1 \<or> b = 1"

request_5.formal_statement:
lemma even_product_prime:
  assumes "p = a * b" and "p prime" and "even p"
  shows "p = 2 \<and> (a = 1 \<or> b = 1)"

request_6.formal_statement:
lemma solve_product_eq:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a * b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 2 \<or> a = 2 \<and> b = 1"

request_7.formal_statement:
lemma product_equals_two:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a * b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 ∧ b = 2 ∨ a = 2 ∧ b = 1"

request_8.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "prime (a * b)"
  shows "a = 1 ∨ b = 1"

request_9.formal_statement:
lemma prime_even:
  assumes "prime p" "p mod 2 = 0"
  shows "p = 2"

request_10.formal_statement:
lemma solve_factor_equation:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "(n - 2) * (n - 1) = 2"
  shows "n = 3"

request_11.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "prime ((n - 2) * (n - 1)) \<longleftrightarrow> (n = 3)"

request_12.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_two_integers:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "prime (a * b) \<longleftrightarrow> (a = 1 ∧ b = p) ∨ (a = p ∧ b = 1)"

request_13.formal_statement:
lemma even_odd_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "even a" "odd b"
  shows "even (a * b)"

request_14.formal_statement:
lemma not_prime_for_large_n:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 3"
  shows "\<not> prime ((n - 2) * (n - 1))"

request_15.formal_statement:
lemma only_even_prime:
  shows "∀p. prime p ⟹ (p = 2) ∨ (odd p)"

request_16.formal_statement:
lemma check_prime:
  fixes p :: nat
  assumes "p = (n - 2) * (n - 1)"
  shows "prime p ⟷ (p = 2 ∧ n = 3)"

request_17.formal_statement:
lemma prime_factorization:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "prime (n^2 - 3*n + 2) \<longleftrightarrow> (n-2)(n-1) = 2"

request_18.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "prime ((n - 2) * (n - 1))"
  shows "n = 3"

request_19.formal_statement:
lemma even_prime:
  shows "prime p \<Longrightarrow> p = 2 \<or> p % 2 = 1"

request_20.formal_statement:
lemma factor_quadratic:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = (n-1)*(n-2)"

request_21.formal_statement:
lemma consecutive_integers_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a = b + 1"
  shows "a * b = 2 ⟷ (a, b) = (2, 1) ∨ (a, b) = (1, 2)"

request_22.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_consecutive_integers:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "prime ((n-1)*(n-2)) \<longleftrightarrow> (n-1)*(n-2) = 2"

request_23.formal_statement:
lemma factor_quadratic:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = (n - 2) * (n - 1)"
  by (simp add: algebra_simps)

request_24.formal_statement:
lemma prime_properties:
  fixes p :: nat
  assumes "prime p"
  shows "p > 1"
  by (metis prime_def)

request_25.formal_statement:
lemma integer_solution:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a * b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 ∧ b = 2 ∨ a = 2 ∧ b = 1"
  by (metis mult.commute)

request_26.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "prime (a * b)" "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "a = 1 ∨ b = 1"

request_27.formal_statement:
lemma check_prime:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 1"
  shows "prime n \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>k. k > 1 \<and> k < n \<longrightarrow> n mod k \<noteq> 0)"

request_28.formal_statement:
lemma parity_of_factors:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "even (n - 1) \<or> even (n - 2)"

request_29.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_consecutive_integers:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "b = a + 1"
  shows "prime (a * b) \<longleftrightarrow> (a = 1 \<and> b = 2) \<or> (a = 2 \<and> b = 3)"
  by (simp add: assms)

request_30.formal_statement:
lemma consecutive_integers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n > 0 ⟹ (n - 1) * (n - 2) = 2 ⟷ n = 3"

request_32.formal_statement:
lemma factor_and_prime:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
    and "prime ((n-2) * (n-1))"
  shows "n = 3"

request_33.formal_statement:
lemma product_prime_condition:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "prime (a * b)"
  shows "a = 1 \<or> b = 1"

request_34.formal_statement:
lemma small_primes:
  shows "prime 2" 
    and "prime 3" 
    and "prime 5" 
    and "prime 7"

request_35.formal_statement:
lemma quadratic_solution:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> n = 1 \<or> n = 2"

request_36.formal_statement:
lemma is_prime:
  fixes p :: nat
  assumes "p > 1"
  shows "prime p ↔ (∀d. d ∣ p ⟶ d = 1 ∨ d = p)"

request_37.formal_statement:
lemma quadratic_factorization:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = (n-2)*(n-1)"
  shows "n = 2 ∨ n = 1 ∨ n = 3"

request_38.formal_statement:
lemma odd_even_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a mod 2 = 0" "b mod 2 = 1"
  shows "(a * b) mod 2 = 0"

request_39.formal_statement:
lemma factor_and_analyze:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(n - 2) * (n - 1) = 2 \<longrightarrow> n = 3"

request_40.formal_statement:
lemma even_prime:
  shows "prime p \<Longrightarrow> p mod 2 = 0 \<Longrightarrow> p = 2"

request_41.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_consecutive_integers:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(n - 1) * (n - 2) = p \<Longrightarrow> p = 2 \<Longrightarrow> n = 3"

request_43.formal_statement:
lemma prime_factorization:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "prime ((n - 2) * (n - 1)) \<longleftrightarrow> (n - 2 = 1 \<and> n - 1 = 2) \<or> (n - 2 = 2 \<and> n - 1 = 1)"

request_44.formal_statement:
lemma complex_expansion:
  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a-d)(a-c)(a-b) = -(((a^2 - a(b+c)) + bc) * d) + (a^2 - a(b+c) + bc) * a)"

request_47.formal_statement:
lemma case_analysis_n:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(n - 2) * (n - 1) = 2 ⟹ n = 3 ∨ n = 0"

request_48.formal_statement:
lemma prime_even_product:
  assumes "prime p" and "p = a * b"
  shows "p = 2 \<or> a = 1 \<or> b = 1"

request_49.formal_statement:
lemma prime_properties:
  shows "prime p ⟷ (p > 1 ∧ ∀d. d ∣ p ⟶ d = 1 ∨ d = p)"

request_50.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_consecutive_integers:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a * b = p" and "p prime"
  shows "a = 1 ∧ b = 2 ∨ a = 2 ∧ b = 1"
  by (metis assms prime_def)

request_51.formal_statement:
lemma case_analysis_on_n:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "n = 1 \<or> n = 2 \<or> n = 3 \<or> n > 3"
